intro: Gymnosporia antunesii var. genuina, commonly known as the Antunes' gymnosporia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are adapted for animal dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
